intro: Halophila ovalis, commonly known as the common turtle grass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is a seagrass species that thrives in shallow, tropical and subtropical coastal waters, often found in sandy or muddy substrates. The plant has long, narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. It plays a vital role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Halophila ovalis is also important for stabilizing sediments and maintaining water quality in coastal areas.
